#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# ===== Configuration =====
WORKTREE_BASE="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees"
PORT_MIN=6943
PORT_MAX=7020
MAIN_BRANCH="main"
LOCK_FILE="/tmp/socialaize-worktree-port.lock"

# ===== Helper Functions =====

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
log_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }

# Initialize submodules if present
initialize_submodules() {
  local path="$1"
  if [[ -f "$path/.gitmodules" ]]; then
    log_info "Initializing submodules..."
    (cd "$path" && git submodule update --init --recursive)
  fi
}

# Get next available port by scanning existing worktrees (RACE-CONDITION SAFE)
get_next_port() {
  # Acquire exclusive lock - only one process can run this at a time
  (
    # Try flock first, fallback to mkdir
    if command -v flock >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      flock -n 200 || {
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      }
    else
      # Fallback: atomic mkdir lock
      local lock_dir="/tmp/socialaize-worktree.lock"
      if ! mkdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      fi
      trap 'rmdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null' RETURN
    fi

    # === CRITICAL SECTION START ===
    local used_ports=()

    # Scan all worktrees for .env.local files
    while IFS= read -r line; do
      if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
        local wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          local port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ')
          [[ -n "$port" ]] && used_ports+=("$port")
        fi
      fi
    done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

    # Find first available port
    for port in $(seq $PORT_MIN $PORT_MAX); do
      # Check if port is in used_ports array (optimized with grep)
      if printf '%s\n' "${used_ports[@]}" | grep -q -w "$port"; then
        continue
      fi

      # Optional: Check if port is actually in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
          continue
        fi
      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
          continue
        fi
      fi

      echo "$port"
      return 0
    done

    log_error "No available ports in range $PORT_MIN-$PORT_MAX"
    return 1
    # === CRITICAL SECTION END ===

  ) 200>"$LOCK_FILE"
}

# Cleanup on failure
cleanup_on_failure() {
  log_error "Creation failed, rolling back..."

  # Remove worktree if created (with safety check)
  [[ -n "${WORKTREE_DIR:-}" ]] && [[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
    # Safety: ensure we're deleting inside WORKTREE_BASE
    if [[ "$WORKTREE_DIR" == "$WORKTREE_BASE/"* ]]; then
      git worktree remove "$WORKTREE_DIR" --force 2>/dev/null || rm -rf "$WORKTREE_DIR"
    else
      log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside WORKTREE_BASE: $WORKTREE_DIR"
    fi
  }

  # Remove branch if we created it
  [[ -n "${CREATED_BRANCH:-}" ]] && [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]] && {
    git branch -D "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
  }

  log_info "Rollback complete"
  exit 1
}

trap cleanup_on_failure ERR INT TERM

# ===== Parse Arguments =====
FEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"
shift || true

EXISTING_BRANCH=""
TYPE="fullstack"
CUSTOM_PORT=""

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case "$1" in
    --existing-branch)
      EXISTING_BRANCH="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --type)
      TYPE="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --port)
      CUSTOM_PORT="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    *)
      log_error "Unknown option: $1"
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# ===== Validation =====

[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name is required"
  echo "Usage: /worktree-feature <feature-name> [--existing-branch <branch>] [--type <frontend|backend|fullstack>] [--port <port>]"
  exit 1
}

# Validate feature name (alphanumeric, hyphens, underscores only)
[[ ! "$FEATURE_NAME" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$ ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name must contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores"
  exit 1
}

# Validate type
[[ ! "$TYPE" =~ ^(frontend|backend|fullstack)$ ]] && {
  log_error "Type must be one of: frontend, backend, fullstack"
  exit 1
}

# Ensure we're in a git repo
git rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
  log_error "Not in a git repository"
  exit 1
}

# Set branch name and validate
if [[ -n "$EXISTING_BRANCH" ]]; then
  # Validate branch name format (security)
  if [[ ! "$EXISTING_BRANCH" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9/_-]+$ ]]; then
    log_error "Invalid branch name format. Use only: letters, numbers, hyphens, slashes, underscores"
    exit 1
  fi

  BRANCH_NAME="$EXISTING_BRANCH"
  CREATED_BRANCH="false"

  # Fetch latest remote branches
  log_info "Fetching from origin..."
  git fetch origin 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Could not fetch from remote"

  # Check if branch exists locally OR remotely
  local_exists=false
  remote_exists=false

  if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    local_exists=true
  fi

  if git ls-remote --heads origin "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    remote_exists=true
  fi

  if [[ "$local_exists" == false ]] && [[ "$remote_exists" == false ]]; then
    log_error "Branch '$BRANCH_NAME' does not exist locally or remotely"
    exit 1
  fi

else
  BRANCH_NAME="feature/${FEATURE_NAME}"
  CREATED_BRANCH="true"
fi

# Set worktree directory
WORKTREE_DIR="$WORKTREE_BASE/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"

# Check if worktree directory already exists
[[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Worktree directory already exists: $WORKTREE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Validate custom port
if [[ -n "$CUSTOM_PORT" ]]; then
  [[ ! "$CUSTOM_PORT" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be a number"
    exit 1
  }

  [[ "$CUSTOM_PORT" -lt 3000 || "$CUSTOM_PORT" -gt 9999 ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be between 3000-9999"
    exit 1
  }

  # Check if port is in use (prefer nc)
  if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if nc -z localhost "$CUSTOM_PORT" 2>/dev/null; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if lsof -Pi ":$CUSTOM_PORT" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  fi

  PORT="$CUSTOM_PORT"
else
  # Auto-assign port for frontend/fullstack
  if [[ "$TYPE" != "backend" ]]; then
    PORT=$(get_next_port) || exit 1
    log_info "Auto-assigned port: $PORT"
  else
    PORT=""
  fi
fi

# ===== Create Worktree =====

log_info "Creating worktree for feature: $FEATURE_NAME"

# Ensure parent directory exists
mkdir -p "$WORKTREE_BASE"

# Create worktree (FIXED: handle remote-only branches properly)
if [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]]; then
  # New branch from origin/main
  log_info "Creating new branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
  git worktree add -b "$BRANCH_NAME" "$WORKTREE_DIR" "origin/$MAIN_BRANCH"
else
  # Existing branch - handle local vs remote-only properly
  if [[ "$local_exists" == true ]]; then
    # Local branch exists - just check it out
    log_info "Checking out existing local branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  else
    # Remote-only branch - create local tracking branch FIRST
    log_info "Creating local tracking branch for remote: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git branch --track "$BRANCH_NAME" "origin/$BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  fi
fi

# Initialize submodules if present (using helper)
initialize_submodules "$WORKTREE_DIR"

# ===== Configure Worktree =====

# Use subshell to avoid changing directory state
(
  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"

  # Create .env.local with port (if applicable)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > .env.local <<EOF
# Worktree-specific configuration
PORT=$PORT
WORKTREE_NAME=$FEATURE_NAME
WORKTREE_TYPE=$TYPE
EOF

    log_success "Created .env.local with PORT=$PORT"
  fi

  # Symlink shared .env from main repo (if it exists)
  MAIN_REPO_PATH=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")
  if [[ -n "$MAIN_REPO_PATH" ]] && [[ -f "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" ]]; then
    ln -sf "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" .env.shared
    log_info "Symlinked .env.shared from main repo"
  fi

  # Add to .gitignore (optimized with loop)
  touch .gitignore
  for item in ".env.local" ".env.shared" "WORKTREE_README.md" "*.code-workspace"; do
    grep -qxF "$item" .gitignore 2>/dev/null || echo "$item" >> .gitignore
  done

  # Add pnpm script for dev:worktree (only if not already there)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]] && ! grep -q "dev:worktree" package.json 2>/dev/null; then
    pnpm pkg set "scripts.dev:worktree=astro dev --port \${PORT:-6942}" 2>/dev/null || {
      log_warn "Could not add dev:worktree script to package.json"
    }
  fi

  # Create WORKTREE_README.md
  cat > WORKTREE_README.md <<EOF
# Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}

## Worktree Info
- **Branch**: ${BRANCH_NAME}
- **Type**: ${TYPE}
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then echo "- **Port**: ${PORT}"; fi)
- **Created**: $(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")
- **Path**: ${WORKTREE_DIR}

## Quick Start

### Development
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Start dev server (uses PORT from .env.local)
pnpm dev:worktree

# Or manually specify port
pnpm dev -- --port ${PORT}
\`\`\`"
else
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Backend - no dev server needed
pnpm test
\`\`\`"
fi)

### Commands
- **Run tests**: \`pnpm test\`
- **Type check**: \`pnpm run typecheck\`
- **Build**: \`pnpm build\`

### Environment Variables
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "- **.env.local**: Worktree-specific (PORT, WORKTREE_NAME)"
fi)
- **.env.shared**: Symlink to main repo's .env (shared secrets, read-only)
- **Never commit .env.local or .env.shared**

## Merging Back

1. **Ensure tests pass**:
   \`\`\`bash
   pnpm test
   pnpm run typecheck
   \`\`\`

2. **Check for uncommitted changes**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git status
   \`\`\`

3. **Push to remote**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git push origin ${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

4. **Create PR**:
   \`\`\`bash
   gh pr create --base main --head ${BRANCH_NAME}
   # Or manually at: https://github.com/YOUR_ORG/socialaize/compare/${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

5. **After merge, cleanup**:
   \`\`\`bash
   # From main repo:
   /cleanup-worktree ${FEATURE_NAME}
   # Or manually:
   git worktree remove ${WORKTREE_DIR}
   \`\`\`

## Safety Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è DO NOT push directly to main
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Each worktree is independent - changes won't sync automatically
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Shared .env is read-only (symlink) - don't modify in worktree

## Appwrite Functions
If working on functions, remember:
- Each function lives in \`functions-FunctionName\` branch
- Use \`/worktree-functions\` command if you need to modify multiple functions

EOF

  # Create VS Code workspace file
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then

trap - ERR INT TERM

# Get next available port by scanning existing worktrees (RACE-CONDITION SAFE)
get_next_port() {
  # Acquire exclusive lock - only one process can run this at a time
  (
    # Try flock first, fallback to mkdir
    if command -v flock >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      flock -n 200 || {
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      }
    else
      # Fallback: atomic mkdir lock
      local lock_dir="/tmp/socialaize-worktree.lock"
      if ! mkdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      fi
      trap 'rmdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null' RETURN
    fi

    # === CRITICAL SECTION START ===
    local used_ports=()

    # Scan all worktrees for .env.local files
    while IFS= read -r line; do
      if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
        local wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          local port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ')
          [[ -n "$port" ]] && used_ports+=("$port")
        fi
      fi
    done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

    # Find first available port
    for port in $(seq $PORT_MIN $PORT_MAX); do
      # Check if port is in used_ports array (optimized with grep)
      if [[ ${#used_ports[@]} -gt 0 ]] && printf '%s\n' "${used_ports[@]}" | grep -q -w "$port"; then
        continue
      fi

      # Optional: Check if port is actually in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
          continue
        fi
      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
          continue
        fi
      fi

      echo "$port"
      return 0
    done

    log_error "No available ports in range $PORT_MIN-$PORT_MAX"
    return 1
    # === CRITICAL SECTION END ===

  ) 200>"$LOCK_FILE"
}

I see the issue! The trap is set with `RETURN` which means it will execute when the function returns. However, when we do `return 0` on line 80 or `return 1` on lines 35, 42, and 84, the trap should fire.

But wait - the trap is inside the subshell `( ... )`. When the subshell exits (even with a return statement), the trap should execute. But the issue is that the subshell is being called with file descriptor redirection `200>"$LOCK_FILE"` which might be keeping things open.

Actually, I think the real issue is that when we `return 1` on line 42, we're returning from the subshell before the trap is set up! The trap is set on line 44, but we return early on line 42 if the mkdir fails.

Let me fix this by restructuring the lock logic.

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# ===== Configuration =====
WORKTREE_BASE="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees"
PORT_MIN=6943
PORT_MAX=7020
MAIN_BRANCH="main"
LOCK_FILE="/tmp/socialaize-worktree-port.lock"

# ===== Helper Functions =====

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
log_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }

# Initialize submodules if present
initialize_submodules() {
  local path="$1"
  if [[ -f "$path/.gitmodules" ]]; then
    log_info "Initializing submodules..."
    (cd "$path" && git submodule update --init --recursive)
  fi
}

# Get next available port by scanning existing worktrees (RACE-CONDITION SAFE)
get_next_port() {
  # Acquire exclusive lock - only one process can run this at a time
  (
    # Try flock first, fallback to mkdir
    if command -v flock >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      flock -n 200 || {
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      }
    else
      # Fallback: atomic mkdir lock
      local lock_dir="/tmp/socialaize-worktree.lock"
      if ! mkdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      fi
      trap 'rmdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null' RETURN
    fi

    # === CRITICAL SECTION START ===
    local used_ports=()

    # Scan all worktrees for .env.local files
    while IFS= read -r line; do
      if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
        local wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          local port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ')
          [[ -n "$port" ]] && used_ports+=("$port")
        fi
      fi
    done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

    # Find first available port
    for port in $(seq $PORT_MIN $PORT_MAX); do
      # Check if port is in used_ports array (optimized with grep)
      if [[ ${#used_ports[@]} -gt 0 ]] && printf '%s\n' "${used_ports[@]}" | grep -q -w "$port"; then
        continue
      fi

      # Optional: Check if port is actually in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
          continue
        fi
      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
          continue
        fi
      fi

      echo "$port"
      return 0
    done

    log_error "No available ports in range $PORT_MIN-$PORT_MAX"
    return 1
    # === CRITICAL SECTION END ===

  ) 200>"$LOCK_FILE"
}

# Cleanup on failure
cleanup_on_failure() {
  log_error "Creation failed, rolling back..."

  # Remove worktree if created (with safety check)
  [[ -n "${WORKTREE_DIR:-}" ]] && [[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
    # Safety: ensure we're deleting inside WORKTREE_BASE
    if [[ "$WORKTREE_DIR" == "$WORKTREE_BASE/"* ]]; then
      git worktree remove "$WORKTREE_DIR" --force 2>/dev/null || rm -rf "$WORKTREE_DIR"
    else
      log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside WORKTREE_BASE: $WORKTREE_DIR"
    fi
  }

  # Remove branch if we created it
  [[ -n "${CREATED_BRANCH:-}" ]] && [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]] && {
    git branch -D "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
  }

  log_info "Rollback complete"
  exit 1
}

trap cleanup_on_failure ERR INT TERM

# ===== Parse Arguments =====
FEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"
shift || true

EXISTING_BRANCH=""
TYPE="fullstack"
CUSTOM_PORT=""

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case "$1" in
    --existing-branch)
      EXISTING_BRANCH="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --type)
      TYPE="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --port)
      CUSTOM_PORT="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    *)
      log_error "Unknown option: $1"
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# ===== Validation =====

[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name is required"
  echo "Usage: /worktree-feature <feature-name> [--existing-branch <branch>] [--type <frontend|backend|fullstack>] [--port <port>]"
  exit 1
}

# Validate feature name (alphanumeric, hyphens, underscores only)
[[ ! "$FEATURE_NAME" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$ ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name must contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores"
  exit 1
}

# Validate type
[[ ! "$TYPE" =~ ^(frontend|backend|fullstack)$ ]] && {
  log_error "Type must be one of: frontend, backend, fullstack"
  exit 1
}

# Ensure we're in a git repo
git rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
  log_error "Not in a git repository"
  exit 1
}

# Set branch name and validate
if [[ -n "$EXISTING_BRANCH" ]]; then
  # Validate branch name format (security)
  if [[ ! "$EXISTING_BRANCH" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9/_-]+$ ]]; then
    log_error "Invalid branch name format. Use only: letters, numbers, hyphens, slashes, underscores"
    exit 1
  fi

  BRANCH_NAME="$EXISTING_BRANCH"
  CREATED_BRANCH="false"

  # Fetch latest remote branches
  log_info "Fetching from origin..."
  git fetch origin 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Could not fetch from remote"

  # Check if branch exists locally OR remotely
  local_exists=false
  remote_exists=false

  if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    local_exists=true
  fi

  if git ls-remote --heads origin "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    remote_exists=true
  fi

  if [[ "$local_exists" == false ]] && [[ "$remote_exists" == false ]]; then
    log_error "Branch '$BRANCH_NAME' does not exist locally or remotely"
    exit 1
  fi

else
  BRANCH_NAME="feature/${FEATURE_NAME}"
  CREATED_BRANCH="true"
fi

# Set worktree directory
WORKTREE_DIR="$WORKTREE_BASE/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"

# Check if worktree directory already exists
[[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Worktree directory already exists: $WORKTREE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Validate custom port
if [[ -n "$CUSTOM_PORT" ]]; then
  [[ ! "$CUSTOM_PORT" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be a number"
    exit 1
  }

  [[ "$CUSTOM_PORT" -lt 3000 || "$CUSTOM_PORT" -gt 9999 ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be between 3000-9999"
    exit 1
  }

  # Check if port is in use (prefer nc)
  if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if nc -z localhost "$CUSTOM_PORT" 2>/dev/null; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if lsof -Pi ":$CUSTOM_PORT" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  fi

  PORT="$CUSTOM_PORT"
else
  # Auto-assign port for frontend/fullstack
  if [[ "$TYPE" != "backend" ]]; then
    PORT=$(get_next_port) || exit 1
    log_info "Auto-assigned port: $PORT"
  else
    PORT=""
  fi
fi

# ===== Create Worktree =====

log_info "Creating worktree for feature: $FEATURE_NAME"

# Ensure parent directory exists
mkdir -p "$WORKTREE_BASE"

# Create worktree (FIXED: handle remote-only branches properly)
if [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]]; then
  # New branch from origin/main
  log_info "Creating new branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
  git worktree add -b "$BRANCH_NAME" "$WORKTREE_DIR" "origin/$MAIN_BRANCH"
else
  # Existing branch - handle local vs remote-only properly
  if [[ "$local_exists" == true ]]; then
    # Local branch exists - just check it out
    log_info "Checking out existing local branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  else
    # Remote-only branch - create local tracking branch FIRST
    log_info "Creating local tracking branch for remote: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git branch --track "$BRANCH_NAME" "origin/$BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  fi
fi

# Initialize submodules if present (using helper)
initialize_submodules "$WORKTREE_DIR"

# ===== Configure Worktree =====

# Use subshell to avoid changing directory state
(
  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"

  # Create .env.local with port (if applicable)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > .env.local <<EOF
# Worktree-specific configuration
PORT=$PORT
WORKTREE_NAME=$FEATURE_NAME
WORKTREE_TYPE=$TYPE
EOF

    log_success "Created .env.local with PORT=$PORT"
  fi

  # Symlink shared .env from main repo (if it exists)
  MAIN_REPO_PATH=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")
  if [[ -n "$MAIN_REPO_PATH" ]] && [[ -f "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" ]]; then
    ln -sf "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" .env.shared
    log_info "Symlinked .env.shared from main repo"
  fi

  # Add to .gitignore (optimized with loop)
  touch .gitignore
  for item in ".env.local" ".env.shared" "WORKTREE_README.md" "*.code-workspace"; do
    grep -qxF "$item" .gitignore 2>/dev/null || echo "$item" >> .gitignore
  done

  # Add pnpm script for dev:worktree (only if not already there)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]] && ! grep -q "dev:worktree" package.json 2>/dev/null; then
    pnpm pkg set "scripts.dev:worktree=astro dev --port \${PORT:-6942}" 2>/dev/null || {
      log_warn "Could not add dev:worktree script to package.json"
    }
  fi

  # Create WORKTREE_README.md
  cat > WORKTREE_README.md <<EOF
# Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}

## Worktree Info
- **Branch**: ${BRANCH_NAME}
- **Type**: ${TYPE}
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then echo "- **Port**: ${PORT}"; fi)
- **Created**: $(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")
- **Path**: ${WORKTREE_DIR}

## Quick Start

### Development
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Start dev server (uses PORT from .env.local)
pnpm dev:worktree

# Or manually specify port
pnpm dev -- --port ${PORT}
\`\`\`"
else
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Backend - no dev server needed
pnpm test
\`\`\`"
fi)

### Commands
- **Run tests**: \`pnpm test\`
- **Type check**: \`pnpm run typecheck\`
- **Build**: \`pnpm build\`

### Environment Variables
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "- **.env.local**: Worktree-specific (PORT, WORKTREE_NAME)"
fi)
- **.env.shared**: Symlink to main repo's .env (shared secrets, read-only)
- **Never commit .env.local or .env.shared**

## Merging Back

1. **Ensure tests pass**:
   \`\`\`bash
   pnpm test
   pnpm run typecheck
   \`\`\`

2. **Check for uncommitted changes**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git status
   \`\`\`

3. **Push to remote**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git push origin ${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

4. **Create PR**:
   \`\`\`bash
   gh pr create --base main --head ${BRANCH_NAME}
   # Or manually at: https://github.com/YOUR_ORG/socialaize/compare/${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

5. **After merge, cleanup**:
   \`\`\`bash
   # From main repo:
   /cleanup-worktree ${FEATURE_NAME}
   # Or manually:
   git worktree remove ${WORKTREE_DIR}
   \`\`\`

## Safety Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è DO NOT push directly to main
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Each worktree is independent - changes won't sync automatically
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Shared .env is read-only (symlink) - don't modify in worktree

## Appwrite Functions
If working on functions, remember:
- Each function lives in \`functions-FunctionName\` branch
- Use \`/worktree-functions\` command if you need to modify multiple functions

EOF

  # Create VS Code workspace file
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > "${FEATURE_NAME}.code-workspace" <<EOF
{
  "folders": [
    {
      "path": ".",
      "name": "Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}"
    }
  ],
  "settings": {

      "vue.volar"
    ]
  }
}
EOF
  fi
)

# Disable trap on successful completion
trap - ERR INT TERM

# ===== Output Success =====

echo ""
log_success "Worktree created successfully!"
echo ""
echo "üìÅ Location: $WORKTREE_DIR"
echo "üåø Branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "üîå Dev Server Port: $PORT"
echo ""
echo "üöÄ Next Steps:"
echo "1. Open new Claude Code session: code $WORKTREE_DIR"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "   Or open workspace: code $WORKTREE_DIR/${FEATURE_NAME}.code-workspace"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "2. Start dev server: cd $WORKTREE_DIR && pnpm dev:worktree"
[[ -z "$PORT" ]] && echo "2. Run tests: cd $WORKTREE_DIR && pnpm test"
echo "3. Begin development on feature: $FEATURE_NAME"
echo ""
echo "üí° Tips:"
echo "- See WORKTREE_README.md for full instructions"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "- .env.local contains PORT=$PORT"
echo "- .env.shared is symlinked from main repo (read-only)"
echo ""

content.thinking:
I see! The test-existing worktree is using the branch `test-existing-branch` which doesn't start with `feature/`, so it's not being picked up by the list-worktrees script which filters for `feature/` branches only.

This is actually a limitation in the script - it assumes all feature worktrees use branches that start with `feature/`. Since we allowed users to specify --existing-branch with any name, the script should handle this case.

But actually, looking at the use case, this is probably OK because the script is designed to list "feature worktrees" which are expected to be on feature/* branches. Worktrees on other branches might be for different purposes.

However, I should note this as a potential enhancement. For now, let me continue with testing the worktree-status command.
